title: Getting started with quallmer
text: get started quallmer, first need install package GitHub. , can load package begin using functions.
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("SeraphineM/quallmer") library(quallmer) #> Loading required package: ellmer

title: Getting started with quallmer
text: Using annotate(), users can generate structured, interpretable outputs powered large language models (LLMs). package includes library predefined tasks common qualitative coding needs, sentiment analysis, thematic coding, stance detection. also allows users create custom annotation tasks tailored specific research questions data types using define_task(). tutorials guide following topics: Signing OpenAI API key: tutorial guide process obtaining API key OpenAI, necessary using OpenAI’s LLMs quallmer package. Working open-source Ollama model: tutorial demonstrate use quallmer package open-source Ollama model qualitative coding tasks.

title: Getting started with quallmer
text: quallmer package provides powerful flexible framework integrating large language models research workflows. leveraging LLMs, users can automate various text, image, video, etc., processing tasks, summarization, classification, scoring. package’s ability structure LLM responses customize output formats makes valuable tool researchers analysts looking harness capabilities LLMs work. detailed examples use cases, please refer vignettes documentation provided package.

title: Example: Sentiment analysis
code: library(quallmer) ## Loading required package: ellmer #Example texts texts <- c( "This is wonderful!", "I really dislike this approach.", "The results are somewhat disappointing.", "Absolutely fantastic work!" )

what: Using annotate() for sentiment analysis of texts
title: Example: Sentiment analysis
code: # Apply predefined sentiment task with sentiment() in the annotate() function result <- annotate(texts, task = sentiment(), chat_fn = chat_openai, model = "gpt-4o") ## Running task 'Sentiment analysis' using model: gpt-4o ## [working] (0 + 0) -> 3 -> 1 | ■■■■■■■■■                         25% ## [working] (0 + 0) -> 0 -> 4 | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■  100% result

what: Qualitative analysis with large language models.
title: Qualitative analysis with large language models.
text: quallmer package easy--use tool qualitative researchers quickly apply AI-assisted annotation texts, images, pdfs, tabular data structured data. Using annotate(), users can generate structured, interpretable outputs powered large language models (LLMs). package includes library predefined tasks common qualitative coding needs, sentiment analysis, thematic coding, stance detection. also allows users create custom annotation tasks tailored specific research questions data types using define_task(). ensure quality reliability AI-generated annotations, quallmer offers tools comparing LLM outputs human-coded data assessing inter-coder reliability. agreement(), users can launch interactive app manually code data, review AI annotations, evaluate intercoder reliability coders agreement LLM-generated scores. quallmer package makes AI-assisted qualitative coding accessible without requiring deep expertise R, programming machine learning.

title: Qualitative analysis with large language models.
text: Create custom annotation tasks structured outputs. Uses system_prompt type_object() ellmer package define LLM interpret inputs format outputs. Tasks created define_task() can passed directly annotate(). allows users tailor annotation process specific data types makes package extensible future use cases.

title: Qualitative analysis with large language models.
text: Launches interactive app manually code data review LLM-generated annotations. Compares AI annotations human-coded data evaluate agreement inter-coder reliability.

title: Qualitative analysis with large language models.
text: package supports LLMs currently available ellmer package: authentication usage LLMs, please refer respective ellmer documentation . example, use chat_openai models, need sign API key OpenAI can save .Renviron file OPENAI_API_KEY. use chat_ollama models, first download install Ollama. install models either command line (e.g. ollama pull llama3.1) within R using rollama package. Ollama app must running models used. Please see tutorials step--step instructions using different LLMs quallmer.

title: Define an annotation task — define_task
text: name Name task system_prompt System prompt required ellmer's chat_fn (text guide model) type_object Structured output definition (ellmer's type_object) input_type Type input data: "text", "image", "audio", etc.
